meanings.definition: The process of removing water or liquid from an area.
meanings.sent1: After heavy rain, the drainage in our backyard helps prevent flooding.
meanings.sent2: The city invested in better drainage to avoid water buildup on the streets.
meanings.sent3: The drainage in the kitchen sink seems to have a mind of its own, always clogging up at the worst times.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like efficient drainage, clearing away any tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The drainage system in the park was so well-designed that even after a storm, the paths remained dry.

meanings.definition: The system of pipes or channels used to remove water or liquid from an area.
meanings.sent1: The old building had a complex drainage system that kept it dry during heavy downpours.
meanings.sent2: The maintenance crew worked tirelessly to ensure the drainage was clear of any debris.
meanings.sent3: The raccoons in the neighborhood seemed to think the drainage pipes were their personal playground.
meanings.sent4: Her voice flowed smoothly through the song, like water through a well-designed drainage system.
meanings.sent5: The ancient city's intricate drainage network was a marvel of engineering, still functional after centuries.
